sub_title: Geo Spatial Development Manager @ ofi | Geospatial Data Architecture, Natural Capital Monitoring
summary:
As a Geo Spatial Development Manager at OFI, I leverage my data architecture and natural capital accounting skills to create and manage geospatial tools, content, and spatial data analysis for various agricultural supply chain origins. I have over 12 years of experience in the fields of economics, agriculture, and data analysis, and I am passionate about using innovation, hard work, and clear goals to deliver results.

My current role involves mainstreaming and increasing the internal adoption of spatial data use and geography across business units, as well as measuring and reporting on deforestation, land use change, ecosystem conversion, biodiversity, and water metrics. I also have extensive experience in developing and implementing business intelligence, impact assessment, and survey instruments for different clients and partners in the agribusiness sector. My mission is to enable data-driven decision making and sustainable practices for OFI and its stakeholders.

projects.title: Grow Africa - Online Community Platform
projects.description: The Grow Africa Online Community Platform has integrated the latest developments in Social Client Relationship Management to build a B2B / Business-2-Business (and O2O / Organization-2-Organization) network reflecting the Grow Africa Initiative's multi-stakeholder approach to connecting and convening the most influential agents in African agricultural growth Agenda, ranging from the African Union, NEPAD, World Economic Forum, to local businesses NGOs and Farmer Organizations across the 12 CAADP member countries. It connects all stakeholders to the first private sector monitoring and evaluation system for international development in Africa, contributing to transparency, accountability, and access to information in a low bandwidth environment.

projects.title: Gender Mapper
projects.description: The International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) and the International Water Management Institute (IWMI) are developing a "gender map" of agriculture in Sub-Saharan Africa in order to better understand how to target agricultural interventions to women and men farmers.

projects.title: UNJLC Convoy from Khartoum to Juba
projects.description: UNJLC organized and led a light vehicle convoy of six vehicles (2 UNJLC vehicles, 2 WFP vehicles, 1 UN-DSS vehicle, and 1 War Child vehicle) and 12 persons from Khartoum to Juba. This convoy was a preliminary step in the South Sudan Resident Coordinator’s Office’s on-going efforts to explore the potential for overland travel throughout South Sudan in the Dry and Wet seasons in order to increase the efficiency and cost of operations in the region. The convoy’s objectives were to transport additional vehicles to Juba facilities, conduct a preliminary survey of overland travel options between northern and southern Sudan, assess limitations on infrastructure and logistics, conduct GPS road mapping, and basic security assessment.

projects.title: Agricultural Water Management Solutions - Investment Visualizer
projects.description:
The Agricultural Water Management Solutions Project (AWM Solutions) has identified a variety of small-holder agricultural water management interventions (AWM Regional Mapping ) that have a high potential to improve the food security and livelihoods of the rural poor in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia. The study results have now been made available online through the Investment Visualizer tool. This tool is directed at policymakers and investors in agricultural water management in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia to assess the profits, costs, yield improvements, number of (poor) people reached, area expansion, and water use consumption of various smallholder water management options by country and region. 

An ex-ante GIS analysis uses a set of suitability criteria to identify areas where the technology could potentially be applied, pixel by pixel, across the region based on environmental suitability and labor availability. The results are then further refined through the application of two biophysical and economic predictive modeling tools: the Soil and Water Assessment Tool (SWAT) and the model of Dynamic Research Evaluation for Management (DREAM) for a combined agronomic-economic-hydrologic cost-benefit analysis for each crop and technology assessed. Given limited market access in much of sub-Saharan Africa, we simulate local, national and international crop markets for this region, for vegetable, root and cereal crops, respectively.

authors.headline: Geo Spatial Development Manager @ ofi | Geospatial Data Architecture, Natural Capital Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
I am currently responsible for OFI / Olam geospatial tools, content, and spatial data analysis for Deforestation, Land Use Change, Ecosystem conversion, biodiversity, and water metrics for ~40 supply chain origins in the Coffee, Cocoa, Dairy, Nuts, Spices sectors
GeoSpatial Data Architecture, Use Cases Development, Crop Mapping, Natural Capital and Environmental monitoring at different geographic and supply chain levels, surfacing locational intelligence on suppliers, partnerships, subsidiaries, etc...  Mainstreaming and increasing internal adoption of spatial data use and geography across business units
profile_positions.title: Geo Spatial Development Manager

profile_positions.description: I am responsible for methodology, survey instruments, data visualization and business intelligence dashboard client systems. SCOPEInsight's business intelligence data and farmer association benchmarking plays a leading role in the Agribusiness Market Ecosystem Alliance (AMEA) and measuring the professionalization of farmer organizations around the world.
profile_positions.title: Business Intelligence Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Pearl Cocoa Ltd (Uganda) - Business Case Development and Investor Relations for to create East Africa's first entirely African, environmentally and socially sustainable cocoa value chain
 - Symbiotics Group (Switzerland) - Agricultural Innovation, Impact Investment Strategy & Advisory Research on Agricultural Value Chain and AgTech Opportunties
 - OpalCrest (Singapore) – AgData/Tech  Consultation services on  smallholder trace-ability & remote sensing integration with agricultural supply chain analytics 
 - Smart Globe International (Cameroon) – Business Advisory, Finance Planning for Inclusive Coffee & Cocoa development in North West Cameroon
profile_positions.title: Business Strategy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and led implementation of online Monitoring and Evaluation System for private sector food and agriculture investments to support CAADP Joint Sector Reviews across 12 New Alliance for Agriculture and Nutrition countries
 - Created and managed online community platform to facilitate all global stakeholders’ access to transparent and accountable corporate self-reporting and automated analysis infographics, maps, & tables
 - Translated an Excel based smallholder accounting tool into a public, cloud hosted net present value (NPV) farm investment evaluator - Gap Analysis Tool for Agriculture (GATA)
 - Scoped, Tendered and Managed delivery of 3 Business Case Studies on Inclusive Investment in Africa’s rural economy, implemented with Dalberg and Grow Africa constituent companies
 - Convened and managed multi-stakeholder working group to develop business cases for using technology and data innovations in African agribusiness
profile_positions.title: Program Manager for Information and Reporting

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and oversaw implementation of  mobile data collection instruments for a Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT) Impact Evaluation of smallholder irrigation on household nutritional consumption, under-5 stunting and wasting using anthropometric measurement
 - Spatial / GIS manager and data analyst for the Gates Foundation Agricultural Water Management Solutions project. Delivered environmental and demographic analyses on investment potential for small-scale irrigation across South Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa
 - Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) grant awardee and principal investigator for exploratory research on spatial econometrics of malaria and Integrated Pest/Vector Management in Uganda
 - Developed survey instruments for environmental and livelihood impact evaluation of multiuse reservoir development for the Mekong River Commission in the Sesan tributaries in Cambodia
 - Oversaw stakeholder interviews and primary budget data collection in Nigeria for a public expenditure review of agricultural irrigation infrastructure management & maintenance
profile_positions.title: Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
- Established data-infrastructure to manage and integrate proprietary and third-party datasets for 250 health surveys in 80 countries
 - Geo-reference and quality-controlled anonymous locations for 65 DHS, MIS, & SPA cluster surveys
 - Authored and edited technical manuals for listing, sampling, GPS data-collection, data-processing, and spatial methodologies for use of geo-referenced cluster-level indicators
profile_positions.title: Data Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Supported the South Sudan Resident Coordinator (RC)’s office in decision making based on logistical and road access assessments and information products on food aid delivery efforts and seasonal logistics accessibility
 - Provided technical assistance, training workshops to the South Sudan Ministry of Transportation and Roads (MOTR) for logistics assessment and geographic information systems
 - Developed a “road-status” mapping system using ESRI ArcGIS for daily field-reports & disseminating road closure information through update service for the humanitarian community
 - Provided transportation and aid-delivery mapping/efficiency-analysis for the humanitarian community and donors working in the earthquake affected area
profile_positions.title: Field Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
